name: StoriiCare
description:
StoriiCare is an all in one software solution for care providers. 

StoriiCare is setting the gold standard for person-centred care. Our cloud based software is used by senior living communities, nursing homes and home care agencies, enabling families to connect with their loved ones and care staff to digitally record their care. 

Our platform includes a range of features from digital care plans, risk assessments and staff tasks, to music playlists and activities for care recipients. Families and care staff can collaborate from around the world to ensure care provided to their loved ones is truly person-centred.

team.title: CEO
team.name: Cameron Graham
team.bioHtml: Co-Founder of StoriiCare - Setting the gold standard for person-centred care • Studied at @University of Strathclyde, Glasgow

team.title: Co-Founder and CEO
team.name: Cameron Graham
team.bioHtml: Co-Founder of StoriiCare - Setting the gold standard for person-centred care • Studied at @University of Strathclyde, Glasgow

jobs.title: Account Executive
jobs.description:
Hi World!
StoriiCare is looking for an incredible Account Executive!

About StoriiCare

At StoriiCare, we are bridging the gap between families and senior care providers. 

StoriiCare is a care co-ordination platform senior care providers with an emphasis on simplicity, visual design and ease-of-use.

Staff use StoriiCare to record the day-to-day care they provide, improving efficiency and enabling relatives from around the world to connect with their loved ones in care. 

To learn more about us, please visit our website at www.storiicare.com

Position Overview

Reporting to the CEO, this is an exciting position that will lead our growth in the US market. You will drive new revenue and deliver world-class support by educating Adult Day Care Centers and Senior Care Facilities across the industry about our products.  

This person will:
• Be a driven self-starter with the ability to build a high volume of lead gen pipeline and carrying quotas
• Be excited by the prospect of building our sales culture and team
• Enjoy being hands-on and conduct cold outreach
• Be highly organized, optimistic, and coachable
• Be capable of navigating complex organizations with multiple decision-makers
• Be able to follow through from lead to winning the sale and follow metrics to shorten sales cycles
• Handle other duties as assigned


Some of your responsibilities will be to: 

• Articulate our business value proposition to decision makers to assess buying interest 
• Research accounts, identify key players, generate lead lists, and win interest 
• Push to go above and beyond quotas
• Sourcing new potential customers, initiating contact & developing relationships
• Actively approach targeted customers (telephone, email, social networks, events, conferences, in-person meetings and demos)
• Keeping an active and regularly updated funnel in our CRM system
• Carry out sales demonstrations with prospective clients both online via 
 Zoom or on-site in person

Skills and experience needed: 
• Experience in the US Senior Care Sector
• Strong communication and coordination skills.
• Ability to multi-task and wear many hats in a start-up environment 
• 1 year sales experience (within a B2B tech company or senior care is a plus) 
• Fearless attitude – willing to take intelligent risks 
• Ability to work in a time-sensitive and high volume environment 
• Ability to work in a team environment 
• Articulate with strong business acumen
• Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing or Sales
• Exceptional English writing skills  
• Tech savvy (ability to operate all Google suite tools such as Docs, Slides, and Sheets). Ability to use teleconferencing apps, email, slack , zoom on a regular basis

Location:
WeWork San Mateo, California (400 Concar Dr)
Working remotely on occasion

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer / Dev Project Manager
jobs.description:
Senior Full Stack Developer


Want to use your skills for good? Our startup is making the lives of senior care staff easier and connecting families around the world with their loved ones in care.


You will play a key role in refining and scaling our platform StoriiCare that supports senior care staff in their day to day workflows, and Storii that enables families to connect with their loved ones in care. The ideal candidate is an ambitious full stack developer who thrives in a startup environment and shares our passion for quality care. This is an opportunity to join a growing, early-stage startup and play a major role in the company’s growth.


Responsibilities:

As a developer, you will join a skilled team of expert database, testing, and development personnel. Each member of the team is afforded opportunities to take on responsibilities according to their experience level and profession growth goals. Our staff mentor each other in their areas of expertise continuously enhancing the synergistic capability of the team.


- Develop all aspects of our web app, including coding, design, and troubleshooting. The front-end of our app has been built in React JS; the backend is in PHP.
- Work closely with other developers to plan and implement architectural decisions.
- Manage and work our MySQL databases.
- Design and develop web applications using modern lifecycle development frameworks.
- Write and maintain technical documentation.
- Peer test application updates.
- Share information on technical skills and mentor coworkers.
- Work in Linux environments, plus an operating system of your choice.

Essential Skills and Experience (Preferred but not all required):

- Bachelor’s Degree (Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, or Math) or six (6) years’ technical experience in developing complex applications.
- JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 (5 years relevant experience)
- Angular, React, or Ember (3 years relevant experience)
- Experience in PHP 7.x
- Strong knowledge of MVC, observer patterns
- Experience in working with PHP frameworks, such as Laravel, Codeigntier
SQL (3 years relevant experience)
- Advanced or intermediate knowledge of Linux Operating Systems, certification encouraged
- Experience and strong desire to invent new ways of approaching problems and developing innovative applications.
- Strong skills in debugging and troubleshooting applications to facilitate fixes and improvements.
- Ability to clearly, without any hesitation communicate ideas to coders, teammates and management.
- Experience in building information management applications and working with relational databases.
- Experience working as part of a team of developers, coders, testers, and CM specialists.
- Strong conceptual understanding and knowledge of AWS and primarily services such as EC2 including load balancing, auto scaling and launch templates, RDS including MySQL and Aurora, S3, Cloudfront, Lambda, Route53 and VPC
- Knowledge of AWS Developer tools such CodeDeploy and recommended knowledge of CodeCommit, CodePipelines
- Two (2) years’ experience in Agile development and peer programming.

Bonus Qualifications

- Knowledge of AWS, Progressive Web Apps, Lambda, Elasticsearch, Kubernetes, Docker

Location:

- Bow, London, UK
- May occasionally travel for short trips Satellite Office in San Francisco

Work Authorization:

- United Kingdom (required)

Salary:

- £45k-£55k DOE + Company Equity Vested

Benefits:

- Aviva Retirement Plan
- Work Perks
- Company Stock Options
- Passionate co-workers 
- Creativity and ownership in your work 
- High impact on company processes
